column4: Greetings, I am having trouble finding the package "compizconfig-settings-manager" in Synaptic.  It lists several compiz packages, all of which i have installed, but the settings manager is not listed as an option to install.  i have an Nvidia 8600GTS which i have the drives installed for.  how do i get compizconfig-settings-manager so that i can utilize the 3d effects?
anyone?  is there someplace i can get the "compizconfig-settings-manager" package that is not listed in Synaptic?  I'm running ubuntu 7.10
you need the correct repo's go into /etc/apt/sources.list and uncomment all the lines beginning with deb
no probs,. then ccsm should be in synaptic
i looked in that directory in File Browser and it is empty
if that file is empty then you should have 0 packages in Synaptic
ah, i'm a moron, i was in the folder sources.list.d
haha,,.so you now have uncommented the correct file?
which file do i uncomment?
uncomment everything thing that begins with deb
i have 5 tabs at the top (Ubuntu software, third party software, updates, authentication, and statistics) i'm not seeing anything that starts with deb
your file should look something like this : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/54563/
you didnt just copy mine over to yours did you?
have you found ccsm?
i removed the #'s from all entries that start with "deb".  now when i load synaptic, i get an error about duplicate source.list entry
pastebin your sources.list file
you made a backup before editing it right?
do you know how to pastebin? pastebin your sources.list that you edited
gd man for making a backup
kk
now post the one you edited
copy this one and see if it works : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/54570/
groovy,.,. dunno wot you did to break it,.,.lol
tbh you should get an update alert in a few mins,.,. but yes you could do
